lead_paragraph: The United States marathon record-holder Deena Kastor will compete in the New York Mini 10K road race Saturday to help prepare for the marathon at the Beijing Olympics. Kastor won the bronze medal in the marathon at the 2004 Athens Olympics. On Saturday, she will be joined by her Olympic marathon teammates Magdalena Lewy-Boulet and Blake Russell as favorites in the 37th running of the women’s 6.2-mile race.
